items.sentence: I think I\'ll go over to Tom\'s this afternoon.
We can\'t believe anything Tom says about Mary.
We can\'t confirm that Canadians were involved.
Do you know when Tom got his driver\'s license?
Dogs that bark a lot usually aren\'t dangerous.
Tom doesn\'t know anything about what happened.
Tom doesn\'t know how to speak French properly.
Tom doesn\'t know where Mary put her suitcases.
Tom doesn\'t know whether Mary is happy or not.
Tom doesn\'t know who he should ask for advice.
Please don\'t hesitate to ask me any questions.
Cities are exciting places, but also stressful.
Could I ask you to wait until tomorrow morning?
Did Tom forgive you for what you did last week?
Did Tom tell you about what he saw on the news?
I\'m sure Tom would\'ve told me if he\'d known.
Tom refused to admit that he\'d made a mistake.
I heard Tom doesn\'t live in Australia anymore.
I hope we\'re going to do something worthwhile.
I just don\'t want to see you get disappointed.
